p: Hypertension seems to enhance the inflammatory profile in patients with SARS-CoV-2 infection, inferring that resistant hypertension possibly increases even more the risk for a more severe illness, as it was already demonstrated that these patients present higher levels of inflammatory biomarkers such as TNF-α and IL-6; however, more evidence is still necessary to elucidate the potential pathophysiological relationship, clinical evolution and eventual risk of patients with resistant hypertension and COVID-19 [ 9].
